bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 20, 1900

div1.p: Reed reports that the experimental camp is nearing completion. He notes the effect of cool weather on yellow fever cases and suggests the mosquito as a vector for the disease.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 20, 1900
div1.p:
I have just
returned from Dr Stark's
where the whole garrison
has been to congratulate
him on his promotion at to
a majority in the volunteer
service- We, of course, as
is customary on such oc-
casions, took a few glasses
of champagne, in order to
drink to his good health, and
to that of his wife. We (that
is your humble service) were
careful to take very little,
as we didn't want to wake
up with a headache in the
morning! I am beginning
to think that Columbia Bar-
racks promises to be very
gay, this winter, with three
events during the past two
weeks- For myself, I don't
propose to patronize any
more of the social events,
as I have something else to
do- I am glad to say that
my experimental station is
almost finished- The houses
are nearing completion, and
before you get this, we will
have begun our observations-
Every body has been willing
to assist me and all seem
to take such an interest
in our work. The Camp
selected is a very good one
& well located- I had not
expected to get it in running
order until Dec 1st, as there
were so many things to do
and to get straightened out.
Dr Kean has been put in charge
of all expenditures for the Camp,
so that this part is entirely
taken off my hands- I have
never seen any one so
much interested in any
work as the Doctor is in
this- He can't do enough
to help me out, and is
at my service at all
times- I am so very glad
that he did not go to the
states, as he was first ordered to do.
Wednesday morning 21st- No headache
this morning, lovie, dear -- but I
came very near oversleeping
myself and thereby failing to get
this letter in the mail- It isn't
a very long or very interesting
letter, but it is better than
no letter; isn't it sweetheart?
and that was my situation on Monday
last when no letter came from
my darling girls- But three came
on Saturday and I guess two or
three, or perhaps four (Quien
Sabe?) will come to-day, and then
I shall be so happy- I know that
you must be having good weather
in the states, as it is so much
warmer here- The cool weather
from Nov. 2nd to 14th, has brought
the fever down 50% in Havana.
That kind of looks like the Mosquito.
Be good children & study your lessons
very hard- Go to the theatre when you
want to- Kisses & love for my dear,
dear girls- Boo! Boo!
